articles.title: Democrats hope to pick up seats in key Virginia districts
articles.description: One of the first states for polls to close is Virginia, where Democrats hope to pick up a number of key seats. CBS News' Kris Van Cleave reports.

articles.title: Trump a factor for many voters in midterm elections
articles.description: President Trump is not on the ballot this year. But nearly two out of three voters said he was a factor in their choice of a House candidate. CBS News White House correspondent Weijia Jiang reports.

articles.title: Republicans face a tough challenge to hold the House
articles.description: The battle for Congress is underway as voting winds down in several states. Republicans, who currently are in the majority in both chambers, face a tough challenge to hold the House. CBS News' Anthony Mason has the latest results from the exit polls.

articles.title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Tuesday, November 6, 2018
articles.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News" with Jeff Glor.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Marijuana on the ballot: Which states could join in on legalized pot?
articles.description: If ballot measures pass in four states, medical marijuana use would be legal in 33 states
articles.content: ST. LOUIS — Voters aren't just choosing between candidates this Election Day. There are 155 ballot measures being considered in 37 states on issues ranging from a carbon tax to expanding access to marijuana. In Missouri, voters have to decide between Republic… [+2260 chars]

articles.title: Susan B. Anthony cast her illegal vote Monday in 1872
articles.description: On Monday 146 years ago, Susan B. Anthony cast an illegal presidential vote that led to her arrest. Now, women visit her grave on election days to honor her fight for women's suffrage

articles.author: CBS/AP

articles.title: What's at stake in Arizona's close Senate race
articles.description: Arizona Senate candidates Rep. Kyrsten Sinema and Rep. Martha McSally have been in a dead heat throughout the race to replace Sen. Jeff Flake. Katie Campbell of the Arizona Capitol Times joined CBSN to discuss this and other important races in Arizona.

articles.title: Will Pennsylvania stay red in the midterms?
articles.description: President Trump won Pennsylvania by just over 44,000 votes in 2016, but Democratic incumbents Gov. Tom Wolf and Sen. Bob Casey are making a push to hold their seats. CBS News' Nicole Sganga joins CBSN with more.

articles.title: What's motivating voters to go to the polls?
articles.description: CBS News political contributor and Republican strategist Leslie Sanchez and CBSN political contributor and Democratic strategist Joel Payne joined CBSN to discuss what's motivating voters in the 2018 midterm elections.

articles.title: Officials working to combat election security threats
articles.description: State and federal officials are working together to combat any potential election cybersecurity threats. CNET senior producer Dan Patterson joined CBSN to discuss the latest.

articles.title: Man pleads guilty in killings of daughters, pregnant wife

articles.title: Democrats work hard to take back governor's offices
articles.description: Dozens of races for governor were at stake Tuesday in states around the country. Gov. Jay Inslee of Washington state is the chairman of the Democratic Governors Association, and he joined CBSN to discuss why these races are so important.

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Stocks close higher on Election Day
articles.description: Industrial and technology companies rallied on strong earnings, while energy companies traded lower

articles.title: 82-year-old votes for first time, dies just days after casting important midterm ballot
articles.description: 82-year-old great-grandmother Gracie Lou Phillips voted for the first time last week in the Texas midterm elections. She died four days later.

articles.title: GOP leaders' outlook on midterm elections
articles.description: Dan Senor, who served as an adviser on the Romney-Ryan presidential campaign in 2012, joins "CBS This Morning" to discuss what Republican leaders are watching for in the midterm elections.

articles.title: Texas teen with special needs scores 50-yard touchdown at high school football game
articles.description: A Texas teen with special needs has always uplifted his high school football team. So, his teammates wanted to do something to lift him up for a change.

articles.title: Economy factcheck: When did America's economic upturn begin?
articles.description: Our CBS News battleground tracker poll finds an overwhelming majority of Americans are optimistic about the economy, with 76 percent of voters rating it as "very" or "somewhat" good. CBS News business analyst Jill Schlesinger joins "CBS This Morning" to discu…

articles.title: Eye Opener at 8: Spice Girls announce reunion tour
articles.description: A look back at what we've been covering on "CBS This Morning." Subscribe to get the Eye Opener delivered straight to your inbox.

articles.description: Beijing also granted 2 more marks to other Trump family companies, raising concerns about conflicts of interest

articles.author: CBS Radio News
articles.title: WORLD NEWS ROUNDUP: 1106
articles.description: Americans go to the polls on Election Day. Amazon reportedly focuses on New York and the Washington area for its second headquarters. CBS News Correspondent Steve Kathan has today's World News Roundup.

articles.description: The driver accused in the hit-and-run deaths of three Wisconsin Girl Scouts and one of their mothers is expected to be formally charged Tuesday. Colten Treu, 21, faces multiple counts of homicide. The girls were collecting trash next to a rural highway over t…

articles.title: Midterm 2018: From Nevada to N.J., which races to watch
articles.description: CBS News chief congressional correspondent Nancy Cordes and CBS News political correspondent Ed O'Keefe join "CBS This Morning" to discuss which Senate and House midterm races we should watch for.

articles.title: Immigration in the spotlight in Texas Senate race
articles.description: In Texas, Republican Sen. Ted Cruz is trying to hold off Democratic challenger Beto O'Rourke. Recent polls reveal a close race with Cruz ahead. The immigration and border issues are taking center stage. Adriana Diaz reports from El Paso.

articles.title: If fate of House comes down to Calif., don't expect decisive results election night
articles.description: We are tracking seven races in California where Republican seats might flip to Democrats, and four of them are in Orange County. Carter Evans reports from Santa Ana, California, with a look at the state's role in the midterms.

articles.title: Governor candidates trash each other as worst thing that could happen to Georgia

articles.title: Florida midterm polls show Democrats with slight edge, but still close
articles.description: Florida voters cast a record number of early ballots. They'll decide high-profile races for governor and the Senate. One of the newest polls show the Democratic candidates with seven-point leads. Manuel Bojorquez reports.

articles.title: Midterm 2018: Polarized electorate heads to the polls
articles.description: A divided nation is voting in a midterm election widely seen as a referendum on President Trump. The voters will decide who controls Congress: the president's allies or opponents who promise to block his agenda and investigate his administration. The presiden…

articles.title: Trump holds his final midterm rally in Missouri
articles.description: President Trump held his final rally before the midterm elections in Cape Girardeau. Missouri. Chris Nagus from CBS St. Louis affiliate KMOV joins CBSN to discuss.

articles.title: Facebook admits it could have done more to stop violence in Myanmar
articles.description: Facebook said Monday that an independent report it commissioned found the company hasn't always done enough to prevent its platform from being used to spread hate speech that has fueled deadly violence in Myanmar.

articles.title: Candidates make last pitch to voters before midterm elections
articles.description: Republican and Democratic candidates on Monday made their last pitch to voters ahead of the 2018 elections. President Trump is on the campaign trail with three rallies.. CBS News political contributor and Republican strategist Leslie Sanchez and CBSN politica…

articles.title: How campaigns use big data tools to microtarget voters
articles.description: Campaigns are utilizing big data tools to microtarget voters, including aggregating public information. CNET senior producer Dan Patterson joined CBSN to discuss how these tools are being used.

articles.title: NFL week 9: Rams finally lose and Tom Brady breaks 80,000 total yards
articles.description: Week 9 of the NFL season saw multiple records broken. Tom Brady became the first player to ever surpass 80,000 total yards, Nick Mullens set a quarterback record during a debut and the NFL no longer has any undefeated team after the Rams fell to the Saints. B…

articles.title: Texas newlyweds killed in helicopter crash shortly after wedding
articles.description: William Troy Byler and Bailee Raye Ackerman Byler, both 24, were killed in a crash shortly after midnight Sunday in rugged terrain in southwest Texas. The pilot on board also died. CBS News correspondent Omar Villafranca reports.

articles.title: Breaking down the Tennessee Senate race and Trump's midterm strategy
articles.description: President Trump drummed up support for GOP Senate candidate Marsha Blackburn ahead of Tuesday's election. Blackburn is in a contentious race against Democrat Phil Bredesen. CBS News' Kathryn Watson has more from the Volunteer State.

articles.description: The Justice Department asked the Supreme Court to bypass three federal courts and allow Trump to terminate the Obama-era DACA program.

articles.title: Early voting among millennials increases in key states
articles.description: Young voters have been unreliable in the past, but in some states like Nevada, early voting shows an increase in millennial participation. Top issues for them include college costs, health care and gun control. CBS News correspondent Jamie Yuccas reports.

articles.title: Pilot in crash that killed newlyweds "very experienced"

articles.title: Utah mayor killed in Afghanistan urged people to vote in last Facebook post
articles.description: A community in Utah is mourning the loss of its mayor, who was killed while he was deployed in Afghanistan. Less than a week before his death, Brent Taylor posted on Facebook, encouraging others to vote. CBS News correspondent John Blackstone reports.

articles.title: More than 5,100 troops at the U.S.-Mexico border as caravan heads north
articles.description: The Pentagon said Monday more than 5,100 U.S. troops are now stationed across the border with Mexico. Their mission is to keep caravans of Central Americans out. CBS News correspondent Mireya Villarreal reports.

articles.title: Iranians take to the streets on first day of new U.S. sanctions
articles.description: Iran is dealing with tough new sanctions Monday. In response, state television broadcast pictures of military exercises, and an anti-American rally was held outside the former U.S. embassy. CBS News foreign correspondent Elizabeth Palmer reports from Tehran.

articles.title: How can Democrats take control of Congress?
